Now works on your dashboard, like, and search pages.
Improved visual styling.
Improved options page.
General fixes and improvements.
A whole new set of icons.
Added a button to the options page in the address bar.
You can now download images straight from someone’s archive.
Completely refactored the code to be more extensible and maintainable in the future.
Settings now sync across multiple options pages.
Files are now downloaded using the native chrome.downloads API.
Improved detection of infinite scrolling.
General fixes and improvements.
You can now specify custom download locations.
Set a default download location where to save all your images.
Your locations and confirmation settings now sync across your Google account.
General fixes and improvements.
You can now download images from slideshows on Tumblelogs. (That is, anywhere where you can bring up a full image view.)
Added support for SSL-enabled dashboards.
Redesigned the options page to resemble that of Tumblr’s.
External links that don’t lead to images will now trigger a confirmation pop-up.
Lots of code adjustments and bug fixes.
Expand inline images in posts to bring up the download button.
Downloaded images now show a small tick even when you’re not hovering over them. You can disable this in the options.
Fixed a bug where images without a MIME type would not download correctly.
